page.title: 18FARMING YEAR
page.content: {WINTER.} To the farmer Winter is a hectic time of year. The main thing to be done is ploughing, which is slow and takes time. Another task is cultivating, which is to break down all the lumps - little tines or prongs of metal go into the soil and when it hits a lump of soil it breaks it into small particles. The purpose of ploughing and cultivating in winter is to make sure that there is enough time for the wheat, barley, oats etc. to ripen by the summer. Also when you plough in winter the frost helps to break down the lumps in the soil. Drilling is the next stage of the farmer's year.
